meanings.definition: Organisms that break down dead or decaying organic matter.
meanings.sent1: The decomposers in the soil help recycle nutrients from old plants.
meanings.sent2: Farmers rely on decomposers like earthworms to enrich the soil.
meanings.sent3: The decomposers at the bottom of the food chain have an important job.
meanings.sent4: In nature's orchestra, decomposers play the crucial role of cleanup crew.
meanings.sent5: Without decomposers, the world would be buried in waste.

meanings.definition: An organism that feeds on and breaks down dead plant or animal matter.
meanings.sent1: Vultures are known as decomposers because they consume dead animals.
meanings.sent2: The decomposers in the forest ecosystem help maintain balance.
meanings.sent3: The decomposers in the compost bin work tirelessly to recycle scraps.
meanings.sent4: The decomposers in the ocean floor are like nature's cleanup crew.
meanings.sent5: The role of decomposers is vital in the circle of life.
